website_summaries.verdict: The best choice for sensitive dogs who suffer with allergies.
pros: Limited ingredients are ideal for dogs with allergies, sensitive skin, and sensitive stomachs
Ingredients are recognizable, healthy choices for your dog
Free of common filler ingredients such as corn, wheat, and soy
cons: Just 6 line has limited flavor options

customer_reviews.title: My dog likes it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dog. He has the Hipster disease of Celiacs. I tried to tell him that free dogs do not get to have weird diseases but he seems to not understand what I am saying. He loves this stuff and has no related digestive items.
customer_reviews.author: lilleth

customer_reviews.title: Was worried my dog wouldn't eat this. HE LOSES IT!
customer_reviews.text: I have been feeding my 12 year old Pomona Rachel Ray Healthy Weight dog food. He loves it the kibble is small. His weight had been an issue and switching to Healthy Weight and green beans got him to perfect weight. So I was no longer able to get it from Amazon. I read the reviews and decided to give this a try. The kibble is almost twice as large. The dog loves it. I can use one piece as a treat. I hope he doesn't gain weight. I have a picture the smallergic one is Healthy Weight, Larger is Just 6.
customer_reviews.author: kindred spirit

customer_reviews.title: Our dog was actually afraid to eat this...
customer_reviews.text: Decided to try this for our dog. He's not a picky eater and not picky with new food whenever we get him new ones but he was afraid to try this after we put some in his bowl. He stepped back from his bowl and hesitated to eat it. He wouldn't finish his food from the very first day until the day we mixed it together with Taste of the Wild. On the last day he ate all the kibbles from the new brand and left this one in his bowl. Must be something in it that he didn't like :/
customer_reviews.author: fromkostocoast

customer_reviews.title: a friend recommended trying a more natural dog food
customer_reviews.text: Our American Bull (Scott type) – Penny – never had skin issues up until about a year ago. At the time, her fur was falling out in patches, and her skin would turn bright pink every time she ate the food we picked up at the grocery store. Assuming the cause was food allergies, a friend recommended trying a more natural dog food. I’d heard good things about Rachael Ray’s line, so we decided to give it a try. Fast-forward to today, Penny’s fur has come back in completely, and her skin never turns pink after she eats. Bonus – she loves the way it tastes, and mom and dad are happy because it’s affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Baron Zumba

customer_reviews.title: Great as always.
customer_reviews.text: My 40 lb. dog has potentially fatal diet sensitivities and needs a minimal ingredient diet. Just 6 is our go-to, he has been on it for years (he is 12). Ordering online is more costly, but we can quarantine it until it is needed without risking our health, especially since we are a high risk household. Hopefully Amazon starts treating their employees better, we are very grateful for what y'all do. I wouldn't recommend this for smaller breeds, the pellets are pretty big (1/4 to 1/2 inch).
customer_reviews.author: Smidge

customer_reviews.title: Great for a sensitive skinned bulldog
customer_reviews.text: I went through SOOO many premium and PRICEY food options (except a RAW diet, which was my last resort) in an effort to find a food that might help my bulldog's itchy and sore-prone skin. This food stopped all skin problems! Thanks, Rachael Ray!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Smirnov

customer_reviews.title: Delivery by USPS is nuts!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this food and I appreciate Rachael Ray for making healthy food my picky older dog wants to eat. Having it delivered by USPS is nuts. If I had known it wasn't coming by UPS I wouldn't have ordered through Amazon. Our mailman doesn't need to walk up our long rural gravel drive carrying a huge box of dog food. Next time I'll make a special trip to the grocery store so he doesn't have to make the special trip for me, he needs to be delivering voting ballots.
customer_reviews.author: zuzus petals

customer_reviews.title: Owner and Dog Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: My dog is very fussy and I have been giving her canned food because she eats it. But when I opened this package and gave her a a small morsel she loved it!!! Then I gave her another, and she wanted more. What is in this that is making my dog love it so much? I know its only 6 ingredients, but I'm guessing with the wheat, corn and soy out, I think she's really able to taste the beef more. Anyway, she is happy, the owner is happy, and life is just well...happy!!! Thanks Rachel for making such a great product and caring about our dogs.!!!
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Bad batch!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs usually love this food but there is something wrong with this batch. It's not out of date but they won't eat it and neither will the neighborhood dogs. I don't know if it's just this bag or if a whole batch is bad but it makes me wonder whether I should buy anymore. I should receive a refund for this product but I didn't open the bag within the required 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GRAIN FREE SIMPLE DOG FOOD!
customer_reviews.text: It asked for my opinion on the flavor? I can't say it taste great because I don't eat dog food but I gave it 5 STARS based on my dog. He eats it with no question. I have a full breed Golden Retriever who honestly should become the next bubble boy since he has so many allergies and skin issues. My vet recommended putting him on a grain free diet and switching his food. So since he has started eating this food (over a year now) he doesn't itch or eat at his paws like he use too. A lot less hot spots and he is happy and healthy!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor G.

customer_reviews.title: Good food for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Feed this to a gsd that is plagued with allergies. While it helps with allergy control it causes a bit of heightened stomach bile production. I also give probios to help digestion of this food. This is great food as far as the price goes however I also have to feed other brands that she digests better. Kibble size is great for medium to large breeds. My picky pups will also eat this voluntarily.
customer_reviews.author: Taborri

customer_reviews.title: Good Budget Friendly option
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs are both sensitive to all proteins other than lamb and one is also allergic to soy. I can give them this food without worrying about upset tummies and allergic reactions and they love it. I love that it’s not as expensive as the prescription food that our vet had them on initially but has taken care of all of the food-related health issues that they had.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy C.

customer_reviews.title: KIBBLE IS "UNCHEWABLE" EVEN FOR BIG DOGS
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying this food for almost 5 month and I need to stop. This kibble is so hard to chew for my 4 dogs that we need to moisten it in water before giving it to them. You may wonder how old are my dogs and even the youngest one (2 years old) and weighting 60 pounds, can't eat this food. At the beginning I was very happy with it but after this situation I'm seeking for other food.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: My two dogs are VERY picky with their food so naturally, I was skeptical buying this product. However, since the dog food that I normally buy became more expensive, I started researching for a better brand and same price points. I found this and tried it. So glad that I did! My dogs LOVES this dog food and can't get enough of it! I will be a repeat customer that's for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Jo’s Foodie

customer_reviews.title: Makes my dog have mushy poops
customer_reviews.text: Just FYI, my pit rescue loves any food and this is no different. She was fed this at the rescue so we continued. However, I mentioned to our trainer that she always seems to have mushy poops, which are light in color and hard to pick up. She suggested I switch because while it isn't a bad brand, it is very rich. We started mixing in some Merrick Raw and immediate change.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Yowell

customer_reviews.title: BEST dog food I have tried for my canine crew in over 10 years!
customer_reviews.text: This dog food is WONDERFUL!!! I foster rescue dogs, and I have 3 of my own, and no other food I have tried was "accepted" by ALL of them except for Rachel Ray Just 6. I really like the lack of fillers and "crap" ingredients...it is just what they need and apparently the flavor is really good because my canice crew goes nuts when they hear me scooping from the bag! :) It also helped a very overweight foster I had drop excess pounds because it has lean proteins and is very easy to digest. And the price is not what you would expect of a high quality dog food...it's very affordable! I 1000% suggest this to any dog parents!
customer_reviews.author: Jey LehewTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I transitioned my dogs over gradually by adding some of this to the food they were all ready eating for about 3-4 days then started feeding thiscto them daily. At first it was ok now my dogs are so sick all three of them. I have three different breeds and all of them are I’ll with Diarrhea diarrhea and have lost weight very upsetting switching back to nature’s recounts cheaper and my dogs did great on it. I only switch to check on a dogs allergy since this was limited ingredients but I’m switching back this dog food is awful
customer_reviews.author: Heather Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it for my Frenchies!
customer_reviews.text: I have Frenchies. They have major food allergies. So, I have to be extremely careful. Well, I read the ingredients & everything looked alright. Well, 4 days in...my tan/black just started reacting to this food. By the 6th, my b/w was vomiting. So, I stopped it & left it in bowls outside for wild animals to eat. I hope you didn't make them I'll. Won't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: NikonWitch

customer_reviews.title: No more smelly poos
customer_reviews.text: We adopted Scruffy after his owner died. He is a great dog. When we first got him we continued to use his same dog food. His poo was so smelly that you would want to puke if you came within 15 feet of them. I really thought he was in poor health and was possibly on his last days as well. He is about 11 years old. We already had a dog that we were feeding this product to so we transitioned Scruffy over to it. Within days his coat brightened up, he was more alert, and most importantly, his craps were almost odorless. OMG its a miracle! Thanks Rachel Ray!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Derrick A

customer_reviews.title: No More Itching!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help resolve an itching problem my dog had that was probably caused by food alergies. I had tried a couple of other brands that were supposed to be anti-allergic but didn't help. This finally did the trick! There has been a noticeable drop in her scratching since she has been on this. She is so much more comfortable now. She does scratch a little every now and then, but I suspect that has to do with her sneaking the cats' food when she can get away with it. I could not be happier with this. It's a bonus that this also costs less than the other hypoallergenic brands that I had tried.
customer_reviews.author: Glenshee Fairy

customer_reviews.title: Bad bag of food!
customer_reviews.text: This is the food my dogs eat. Normally I buy it somewhere else but due to 1 day shipping I purchased here. When I opened the bag there were odd orange granules all over the food. The dogs would hardly eat it. One of my dogs vomited multiple times on the second day along with diarrhea. One bowl of food sat for 3 days. I threw out the entire bag. I replaced it from my normal vendor. It looked different than this bag and everyone ate it like normal. Beware. Not sure if it was old or not authentic or something was on it but it definitely was bad.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Ann

customer_reviews.title: My dog cannot write
customer_reviews.text: Hard to write about dog food. I did not taste it. Dog likes it. But labs eat everything, even wood. And as for the ingredients, I just have to believe what they say on the package. How would I know by looking at a piece of dark brown kibble? So, I buy it because I decided to believe the producer and am attracted by the small amount of the ingredients. I always soak the kibble as it is better for the dogs kidneys and add something fresh: turkey meat, a raw egg or cottage cheese.
customer_reviews.author: ENA winter

customer_reviews.title: Try something else!
customer_reviews.text: My dog started out ok eating this the first couple days, and then simply would not eat it. I mixed it with a better quality dried dog food and he’d pick out the pieces of this food and leave it on the side of his bowl. When I checked dog food advisor it only had 2.5 quality rating, probably not the best choice of dog food to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: Keri

customer_reviews.title: Not a winner 😐
customer_reviews.text: Sad but true 😐 My chihuahua sniffed this food, took a few bites and left it to be swept up ☹️ (and it's about the same size dog food I have already, but by Purina "Bella". All is not lost though, my neighbors dog will probably appreciate it 😄
customer_reviews.author: Ahern

customer_reviews.title: Great deal and rave pup reviews
customer_reviews.text: My dogs stopped eating their Kirkland brand food but since we have two large breeds I needed something they would eat without spending a fortune. I got a couple brands for them to try and this was by far their favorite. We’ve decided to stick with this and have ordered treats from Nutrish as well. It’s crazy how excited my dogs get for this food and for their Nutrish treats compared to anything else we give them.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Don’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: Mine was on this a long time. Came to my attention he was salt deficient. This food does not have adequate salt content necessary for a canine diet. So even though I liked that it was special ingredient, being too low on salt had him doing some weird things.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't bother if your dog is even slightly stomach sensitive.
customer_reviews.text: The reason for my 2 star review is that although my dog loved the flavor right away it increased the times a day that he pooped and then although I did a very gradual transition from his old food to this food once the transition was complete my dog got a severe case of diarrhea. I had to feed him rice and chicken for two weeks and eventually switched back to our old food.
customer_reviews.author: D.S.

customer_reviews.title: Skin allergies cleared up within a week of switching to this food!
customer_reviews.text: My dog had red, itchy skin that just wouldn't go away. Her vet said that she was sensitive to wheat products and ingredients used in cheap dog food. The vet suggested a limited-ingredient formula and after A LOT of research, I decided on this one. This is all my miniature schnauzer mix eats now and her skin cleared up almost immediately! No more scratching or redness. She's happy, healthy, and has SO much energy. You can't beat the quality and price. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Abbey P.

customer_reviews.title: I great dog food for your dog and beloved family member.
customer_reviews.text: My dachshund is going on twelve and was having so many problems with other foods. I had tried many things, other type of dog foods, some of them way more expensive. But to no avail. He continued to ignore his food and lose weight. Then I discovered Rachel Ray's Nutrish Just 6 Natural Dog Food. He loved it. He has gained his weight back and is excited for meal time again. I am so grateful to have found this dog food. I hope this helps anyone else in the same difficult predicament that my dog and I were in, with their dog and beloved family member.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tasty Dog food
customer_reviews.text: We fed this to Grandma. Grandma Loves Rachel Ray, so we showed her the bag and said Rachel sent this grandma. Grandma ate most of the bag in 7, maybe 8 days. Grandma said the food was a little dry and we had to give grandma a laxative after 4 days. Grandma is OK now and asks every day "Anything from Rachel??"
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Healthy and simply ingredients for cheap price
customer_reviews.text: This food is a real DEAL , only simply good ingredients for you dog at amazing price ! Don’t over pay in other brands that offer the same at double the price tag.... my dog loves this food ! And I feel happy knowing I’m giving her a healthy alternative :)
customer_reviews.author: OSNIEL MARRERO

customer_reviews.title: So much poop 😭 I can't feed this anymore
customer_reviews.text: My dog has been on grain free food and meat for a while but as soon as I switched to this there was so much poop in my yard. She's pooping about 5 times a day and she's a big dog so my kids can barely play outside without having to watch for "landmines". I don't know what they're packing this stuff with but you're wasting your money because it doesn't look like any nutrients are getting absorbed. Buy a higher quality food and skip this.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Walker

customer_reviews.title: Great weight management/allergy management option
customer_reviews.text: This dog food is perfect for my small, 20lb, dog. I have been trying to prevent weight gain and weed out a possible allergy for her, so just before trying this food I tried the Wellness brand limited ingredient food for small dogs. This Just 6 is a million times better than the pricey Wellness food! The other brand upset her stomach something fierce but the Just 6 is something she loves to eat and doesn't make her have tummy trouble. She hasn't gained any weight and her allergies seem to have cleared up. She also doesn't mind the regular style kibble and happily chows down. We will be buying this again and again!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Kelly

customer_reviews.title: First dog food my dog doesn't like lol!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old Boston Terrier likes all kinds of food, he’s devoured every kind of kibble I’ve put in front of him. I don’t think there’s anything to do with the brand cause he loved Nutrish Peak but I like switching things up and giving him something new cause he doesn’t have any issues when I change his food. This particular food he won’t touch which makes me laugh cause he has never refused to eat anything besides raw carrots which he hates. First time for everything but now I’m stuck with 20lbs of unusable dog food. Oh well!
customer_reviews.author: yoon s kim

customer_reviews.title: Great for digestive issues and sensitive skin!
customer_reviews.text: Boxer dogs are so loveable and cute really the best companion imaginable! But they can stink you out of your house with their HORRIBLE GAS! I decided to try the Just 6 to see if it would help! Tadaaaa no more stinky! He loves this food!
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Pierce

customer_reviews.title: This wasn't like a little stomach upset - I thought I was ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog has been on a homemade dog food diet and I wanted to add in some kibble. I added a little bit of this to his homemade food and by the third day he was so violently sick he couldn't walk, could barely breathe and wouldn't eat or drink anything (which is incredibly rare for him). This wasn't like a little stomach upset - I thought I was going to have to put him down. Maybe this is a match for others but this food is clearly not as natural as they claim it is - DO NOT BUY if your dog isn't used to eating chemicals and crap.
customer_reviews.author: NR2019

customer_reviews.title: and a client in our vet clinic recommended Rachel Rays Foods
customer_reviews.text: Our dog had thick, warm ears that were all gross on the back side of the ear. She itched her belly all the time. I tried several expensive brands, one made her very sick. This was brand new, and a client in our vet clinic recommended Rachel Rays Foods. Tried it for 6 months. Ears completely cleared up, itching stopped. I have been using it ever since. Have recommended this so many people. Have heard back from those people, about the great results.
customer_reviews.author: Alan D

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is allergic to corn, barley, Green beans, and potatoes. Finding dog food without those ingredients is hard. She was on a different more expensive food that made her smell fishy and that brand only recipe that didn't have any of the ingredients she's allergic to was their fish flavored. So I went looking for another option. I was skeptical because of the celebrity name and cheaper price but she is on her second hag and doing great!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent product
customer_reviews.text: The first bag of this food my 10 pound malti-poo devoured. However, this 2nd bag we received is not the same product. He doesn't like it and either refuses to eat or will only eat 1/2 of the serving. The last 2 weeks I have mixed in with a Wellness brand food to encourage him to at least eat some of the 28# bag I bought. He will only eat the meals that contain 10% or less of Nutrish. I'd like my money back considering the inferior quality of the product and the remaining food weighs 25#.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly B.

customer_reviews.title: Dog food that works
customer_reviews.text: It was well accepted among the 3 diffrent breeds if dogs 2 are purebred dogs 1 is a mix mutt dog 1 med 2 small dogs. I appericate less dog waste. They appreciate feeling full longer. Win win situation.
customer_reviews.author: Janet's  personal opnion

customer_reviews.title: Helped my itchy dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog always smelled really bad (not normal dog smell) and was always scratching. I tried grain free brands from other products but this is the only one that knocked out the horrible smell and itching.
customer_reviews.author: KBCinTX

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves Rachel Ray just 6 lamb and rice
customer_reviews.text: I previously bought a different limited ingredient dog food but that company had quality and contamination issues and was hard to find. I can get this at supermarket or by mail order so more since and I'm confident about quality I joked that it must contain doggie crack as my dog LOVES this more than any other dry food He wags his tail and licks his chops in anticipation when running back into the house each morning for his first meal of the day. Had not tired of it in 5 years
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Mary C.

customer_reviews.title: Good food
customer_reviews.text: My dogs enjoyed this food. No issues switching over. They didn’t have any stomach problems. I got this due to stock being low at the store and I had to try something new. I always go for grain free.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Kuhn

customer_reviews.title: Great for my active dogs
customer_reviews.text: Got this on sale for my dogs when I needed to order everything in. They aren't that picky but they really seemed to enjoy this. I have a German Shorthair Pointer and a Catahoula. The GSP has allergy issues to some dog food so I would notice immediately if this would have bothered him. Both dogs loved this food and seemed to digest it well. I will watch for it to go on sale again.
customer_reviews.author: Birdreader

customer_reviews.title: Too good to be true
customer_reviews.text: On paper this was a good deal compared to retail stores. However he second bag I got smelled "off" and my dog refused to eat it a few days after starting the bag. I tried slowly changing his food with another to not shock his system, but he'd just eat around this food. Eventually I just had to toss it. Won't make this mistake again.
customer_reviews.author: Nick L

customer_reviews.title: My dog is very food motivated and eats pretty much everything but did not care for this food
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived torn and crushed. My dog is very food motivated and eats pretty much everything but did not care for this food.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: This works wonders for her and both my dogs love it. Love the simple ingredients
customer_reviews.text: My dog is allergic to tons and tons of products. This works wonders for her and both my dogs love it. Love the simple ingredients. I know it’s not the highest quality but it’s what works for her so that’s what we buy. Definitely give it a try for dogs with allergies. The simpler the better I have found. We used to buy her expensive skin food and guess what she was allergic to 75% of those ingredients. She also used to get an upset stomach every now and then, or diarrhea and we have yet to have any issue since! Maybe it was related to her food allergies maybe not, but I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna B

customer_reviews.title: Affordable but not one of the better dog foods
customer_reviews.text: Had to switch from Wellness lamb and barley as Just 6 was a less expensive option. It doesn't have probiotics or glucosamine so is not a good long term choice. Less ingredients is a better choice (less filler) when the dog food is not higher quality. The dog is hungrier and poop is not as formed and I need more bags to pick it up so it is not as digestable. It seems to be OK but will go back to Wellness, Canidae, or Merrick.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work out for my allergen prone dog.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves it. She is allergy prone, so I was sticking with fewer ingredients. Her allergy has now developed into a yeast problem, which, from what I understand is from too many carbs for an allergen prone dog. Dogs only need 4 percent, & most dog foods are 40. I am disappointed this did not work for my dog, since she loves it so much.
customer_reviews.author: Sanssouci572

customer_reviews.title: 11 y/o jack russell loves it
customer_reviews.text: Our 11 y/o Jack Russell is usually picky eater so he was on moist puppy food and table scrap diet whole life. He started to eat less and less of the puppy food the last few years so I reluctantly tried this product. I tried dry food before and it was a waste but he genuinely has been eating 1-2 bowls each day and half way done with the bag in just a couple weeks. This food seemed to attract more ants than normal. It doesn't seem to list sugar as ingredient but I can bet that some how it finds a way in there
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This dog food is a great value. My dogs are very picky and I want them to have a high quality food. This product’s ingredients are straightforward and nutritious for my fur babies. I am very impressed by this product and will definitely be reordering since my dogs like it which is a major plus in my eyes.
customer_reviews.author: kelli RN

customer_reviews.title: Pup loves the taste
customer_reviews.text: My picky eater with a sensitive tummy loves this food. With other food I'd have to dress it up and at times he still would not eat. This just wet it and it's gone. Some times he'll eat it dry. This is huge! Plus no tummy issues
customer_reviews.author: jebe

customer_reviews.title: Our Dogs Love This Food.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a simple formula, the dogs love it, and it’s a good price. We used to feed our dogs Nutro. The formula changed and they stopped eating it for some reason. We then tried Sam’s Club brand lamb and rice, but lots of times it was a pain because it was not available or sold out when we needed it. Then we tried Nutrish and they absolutely loved it!!! They love the taste and they never refuse it. It doesn’t give them upset stomachs and they go to the bathroom without any issues. So.... Nutrish is what we’re sticking with.
customer_reviews.author: Leah K. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Dog doesn't like it
customer_reviews.text: Good value for this dog food because it's grain free and only 6 ingredients. The problem is my dog hates it. He will eat anything, but definitely doesn't like this food. We've combined it with another and he'll eat it that way, but won't do it solo without a lot of time. At least he won't be fat...
customer_reviews.author: B. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Made my dogs sick
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised with just 6 ingredients my dogs had tummy issues and diarrhea after eating this after only 3 days of eating this. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Review King & Queen

customer_reviews.title: Something is Wrong with this dog food.
customer_reviews.text: This bag of dog food was really dark which I thought was odd but I don’t usually buy lamb so I thought that was it. My dogs won’t eat this bag. My Westie has eaten the most and she now has loose stools and is lethargic. I am throwing this bag away. Never had trouble before and have used this brand for years. Hope it was just a fluke.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: They stopped eating it.
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 dogs and had to switch their food because the food they were eating has been discontinued. My dogs took to this food and they ate the first bag without issues. The second bag, they didn’t want to eat it anymore. So we are back to searching for a food they will eat. I have one who gets a fungus on his face unless he eats grain free. It’s easier to feed them all the same food.
customer_reviews.author: pegred

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs with allergies
customer_reviews.text: This is the only food I could find that doesn't have anything my dog is allergic to. The poor thing can't have potatoes, grains, rice, milk, beef, or lamb. I joke that she is on a paleo diet. I was so relieved when I found this food for a decent price. My dog seems to like it (she doesn't really have a choice.) I would recommend this to anyone who wants to know exactly what their dog is eating especially if they have an allergy.
customer_reviews.author: Martins

customer_reviews.title: Hey Rachel they love it!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike whatsoever. All around I am VERY please. Been searching for a grain free food quite some time now. Let's face it, the stuff is NOT cheap however, simply 6 was pretty close to same price I was paying for same amount of original food. This is so much healthier for them. All three of my dogs love it! You never know when switching if they wont like, not eat at all. Even the pom and chihuahua/dachshund breeds love. Mainly got for my Shar pei Shepard mix due to looking like previous food was affecting her coat. Itching and chewing herself like crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Brown

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be making a difference in my Boerboel.
customer_reviews.text: I used Purina Pro Plan prior to using this product. My South African Boerboel has many skin sensitivities and food allergies. I decided to try this food to narrow down the ingredients to see if it would cut down on his itching and paw licking. He's been on Just 6 for over 6 months now. He still is licking his paws, but the overall scratching has reduced significantly. I'm about to change him to the Zero Grain formula to see if that makes a greater difference. My only complaint is the price point between the Pro Plan versus the Just 6. I'm paying more for less food, but my dog is improving, so I guess that's the trade off.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cassell

customer_reviews.title: Neither of us were impressed
customer_reviews.text: I got a recue dog and was told this is what she had always been fed. I could not locate this specific formula in stores in my area so I ordered online. The food has a really strong smell and she refused to eat it. It's hard to say if I just got an off bag or what seeing how I couldn't locate in stores. I bought a bag of Nutrish and it smells fine and she's eats it fine. Will just use other Rachel Ray food instead.
customer_reviews.author: FoundItOnAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Dog Food for Picky Eaters
customer_reviews.text: I have two of the pickiest eating Golden Retrievers ever. I ran out of their usual brand and tried the Lamb and Rice. This is the first food they haven’t turned away from, looking at me like I’m feeding them rocks. They’re almost 4 years old and I’ve tried every brand and “flavor” you can imagine. This is a great, healthy product for picky eaters.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Good for dog with food allergies
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the only brands my dog doesn't have allergic reactions to. I'm happy to pay a little extra for quality ingredients to keep my dog healthy and happy. It always seems to be fresh (none of that weird musty dog food smell) and he always gets excited when I open a new bag, so I'm sure he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Kiana

customer_reviews.title: Three large dogs
customer_reviews.text: I feel like the ingredient list was very transparent. But I don’t think my dogs enjoyed it as much as they have other food. They kind of let it sit in their bowl a little longer and would pick at it. They wouldn’t eat it all in one sitting. So I don’t think they really liked it not so sure.
customer_reviews.author: Dayna Thai

customer_reviews.title: Problem with last bag..
customer_reviews.text: Been buying for over a year and the last bag my dog got sick minutes after his first meal.. For days after every time he ate.. Ended up throwing out and changing to another brand.. The big problem with dog food is no one is regulating any of what we feed out pets.. It's all about corporate greed.. Be careful what you buy.. too many big name brands are killing animals with the garbage they add to the ingredients..
customer_reviews.author: Product Critic

customer_reviews.title: pup loves it
customer_reviews.text: My dog goes ape$&%$ over this stuff. Before when we were feeding him Kirkland he could take it or leave it, he didnt really care. When we laid down this bowl of food for him, he devoured the entire thing in less than a couple minutes. The kernels seem like they have a good fat content too, they arent super dried out.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C.

customer_reviews.title: Where is your quality control?
customer_reviews.text: I had bought Just six turkey and peas before trying this for my 7 month old French bulldog who has a sensitive stomach. The size is different from the one I bought from the store and this is much bigger. Also, there are bits of other kibble (that look like either some other cat food or dog food) dispersed throughout and the bag came extremely greasy. Disappointed and worried I am harming my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Brit M

customer_reviews.title: Worth buying on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: My dog does really well on this food. I have a 105 point lab/Pyrenees mix with a very sensitive stomach. Due to his allergies I decided to switch him over to a food brand with minimal ingredients that I could understand. I always buy the lamb flavor (bet recommended non bird meat) and my dog loves it! Keeps his digestion healthy and no complaints from him. Since he’s so big I buy the bigger amazon size due to only find smaller sizes in store.
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Our two greyhounds love this dog food
customer_reviews.text: Our two greyhounds love this dog food! We used to buy another brand from our local pet store, but decided to see how this worked given the convenience of having the product delivered to our doorstep. After doing some research on a dog food advisory website, I found this product to have solid ingredients. We transitioned our dogs slowly, and they had absolutely no issues switching to this food. They are happy and healthy and maintaining a healthy weight. We've been using it for a little over a year and have no plans of going back.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I have a dog with sensitive skin/allergies and needed a limited ingredient food. Its too soon to see how his skin reacts, but so far he and my other dog LOVE this food. They both spent 10 minutes licking their bowels after they'd eaten. I will update when i see how skin reacts.
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: arrived stale
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs love this product, but the bag we received seemed stale. One dog refused to eat it for three days. The local store finally got some back in stock, so we just bought a new bag there, and she ate the "fresh" grocery store version right away.
customer_reviews.author: jsk

customer_reviews.title: Spoiled Shipment Poisoned our Dog
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this food for approximately 6 months with our 5-year old German Shepherd. This last shipment was poisoned/spoiled-- after starting the new bag he was extremely lethargic (to the point he wouldn't get up), refused all foods (including turkey, etc.), and started drooling and was clearly in very bad shape. We rushed him to the vet and they said based on his symptoms and testing, this was highly likely Vitamin D poisoning due to his dry dog food. Lo and behold-- this brand has been recalled before for excess Vitamin D in 2015. This is absolutely poison, do not feed to your dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra cost
customer_reviews.text: We have found that our dog's coat sheds much less and she just appears to be all-around more healthy with this food after we changed from dog food with dyes and artificial flavors. It's worth the extra cost to have a really healthy dog. If you read a dog food bag and it has 30 or 40 ingredients, especially dyes, corn or other unnecessary fillers, or artificial flavors, ask yourself what good that could be doing for your dog.
customer_reviews.author: J. Faurot

customer_reviews.title: They love it!
customer_reviews.text: Our two standard poodles have grain allergies and this food not only is grain free but the dogs love it. Used other grain free dogfood before but they would hardly eat it, only when they were really hungry. They gulp this food down as fast as they can and want more. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Headbanger

customer_reviews.title: Had to Put Dog on a Limited Ingredient Diet after Pancreatitis
customer_reviews.text: My dog was diagnosed with pancreatitis a little over a year ago. After a diet of chicken and rice for a week, we were allowed to start him on a limited ingredient diet dog food. We chose to try this because it was more affordable than other brands but seemed like a quality dog food. Both of my dogs love the food and we have not had any health issues since we began using this!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Healthy and affordable
customer_reviews.text: My dog has problems with pancreatitis, so I switched to this food after realizing I could not afford the food the vet recommended. (I did some research, and this food landed at around the same spot as the recommended food nutritionally. ) He scarfs it right down, and we have not had any problems for 5 years or so. It was also recently approved by the cardiologist.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Changed their ingredients :(
customer_reviews.text: My Frenchie is allergic to everything. When I found this food 6 months ago I was so happy. recently we ordered a new bag and my little girl started breaking out in hives. Patches of her fur were coming off.that’s when I looked at the bag and saw there things she’s highly allergic to added on the ingredients! I was so disappointed, now I have to look for another food and hope she likes it. Back to the drawing board.
customer_reviews.author: Shanna Marie

customer_reviews.title: Good product, needs to be chunkier kibble for me to be a returning customers. My dogs choke on the small Kibble.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs seem to like this a lot. I wish Rachel would do just a larger chunk. My dogs seem to inhale this product quite a bit, meaning, the chunks are so small that that choke for a bit sometimes on this product. ----very tiny chunks for my 75 pound dogs. I think she needs to make a line of products that have a beefier chunk to them. I DO love that it's not filled with fillers.
customer_reviews.author: jbar2000

customer_reviews.title: Fixed my dog's IBS
customer_reviews.text: My Yorkie started having stomach problems a year ago which the vet said was IBS (who would have thought dogs could have IBS, right?) due to old age. I tried the medication they gave me, as well as super expensive grain free dog foods. None of them ever worked. That being said, this dog food (the Just 6 lamb version) 'fixed' his stomach issues. No more diarrhea one day and constipation the next. I will say that once I ran out of the first bag I tried a different kind of Rachael Ray dog food (chicken) and he had the same issues as before. After switching back to this, he was good again after a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great food!
customer_reviews.text: My English Bulldog was suffering from skin allergies, redness and itchy skin. Since she started eating this food, her skin magically healed and now her coat looks so much softer and overall very healthy. She is back to being a happy pup and I am so glad it was such an easy fix! Just changed from Beneful to this food ! And the bonus is that she LOVES IT!
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Premium food at decent price
customer_reviews.text: Not a Rachael fan but her dog food is good, my girlfriend told me to get it because it helps with donations to animal shelters or something. But the food is good, first ingredient is always meat not filler like cheap brands, and it's not overpriced like some of the premium brands. So I've been buying her dry dog food ever since and my dog LOVES it.
customer_reviews.author: Bud Fox

customer_reviews.title: My German Shepherd seems to like it.
customer_reviews.text: My German Shepherd seems to like it. I did not taste it myself. LOL. I choose it for alternative source of protien. Novel protien is supposed to help Canines with peri-anal fistula problems. Seems like good value. I feed him less of this and he seems satisfied. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Riverruns2me

customer_reviews.title: showed up 2 days late- not a good buy
customer_reviews.text: not a good buy when you have to go out and buy dog food at 7 pm bc the one you ordered didn't show up till 2 days after it was supposed to be there. you shouldn't advertise 1 day shipping if its not the case. ended up having to spend extra money and now have food that's no longer needed.
customer_reviews.author: heather stachel

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS FOR YOUR DOG!
customer_reviews.text: Do not order this food. I wish I would have read the reviews before buying. My dog didn't like it and I thought maybe because it was a different flavor than what she had before. I tried adding bone broth to improve the flavor. That's the only way she would eat it and even then, she was hesitant. This morning, she threw up AND had diarrhea. It was terrible. I will NEVER buy dog food on Amazon again and it is an absolute shame that they have no means of quality control on these items.
customer_reviews.author: Kat M

customer_reviews.title: Great Price! Delivery Questionable!
customer_reviews.text: Great food for your dogs. This time it took over a week to get my dog food. Make sure you order way in advance. It said something about weather and there was no problem at all with the weather. I was just very disappointed it took that long when it clearly states 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa C.

customer_reviews.title: This food is fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This is our go to for our Babies. They all 3 have allergies so we have to be very careful what we feed them. This has been by far the best food we have found to help with the allergies!! They are more active and full of energy and just overall happier and healthier since eating this!
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Try this food before spending money on an allergy test!
customer_reviews.text: I had an allergy test done on my dog and it turned out she was allergic to beef along with peas/barley/potatoes/flaxseed which apparently are all very common in dog foods. I searched for a dog food without any of these ingredients and most were so expensive - just 6 was the only one that reasonable in price. My dogs allergies have improved so much - I’ve never seen her eyes or skin so clear. I wish I would have tried this before spending so much on the allergy test!
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: My dog seems to like it
customer_reviews.text: So idk if it’s the Ingredients or because of the weather but the bag came a little wet and the thread from the bottom was coming apart. That being said it was still SUPER hard opening the darn bag. I had to use scissors for it.
customer_reviews.author: Lis

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I was trying to find a dog food with limited ingredients of things my dog (one of three) is not allergic to. This fit the bill and I wanted to be super excited about it! During conversion all three my dogs started to be super itchy, had super loose stool, and didn’t get excited for meal time like they used to. In addition to that, the food smells funny, not like a good quality kibble. Disappointing...
customer_reviews.author: farid

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Food Good Price
customer_reviews.text: So like many others I have struggled to find a food that both of my dogs dont have some allergic reaction to for YEARS! Finally found this after trying vet food, specialty food, science diet, purina, blue buffalo, etc... etc... Every dog is different and has different allergies but I am truly impressed with this food. Its been a long road to find it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Pepper loved it
customer_reviews.text: Pepper loved it from the first day when i got it from the front door he jumped on the box before i could open it.. i guess he could smell it inside the bag inside the box ... and he loves it still and can not wait for me to fill his bowl
customer_reviews.author: Henry T

customer_reviews.title: Love this dog food!
customer_reviews.text: We needed some thing with limited ingredients for our pups that have allergies and this food has been wonderful. Helped reduce redness, itching, shedding, & ear infections. It really isn't much more expensive than other dog foods either.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Saunders

customer_reviews.title: I really liked it until they raised the $$!  I will have to look for something different
customer_reviews.text: I really liked it until they raised the price! It did have value for money but they raised it! I will look for other dog food. It goes up and it goes down. It was around 20 plus like 26 or so. I will look for another dog food.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Good, but has other dog food mixed in
customer_reviews.text: Our dog likes this food most of the time and it is gentle on his stomach. Lately, we have noticed other kibble being present in the bag. We have gotten kibble of different color and shape. This is probably a reflection of the manufacturer's quality control and not the product itself, but it has caused our dog to not always eat this food if there is impostor kibble.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Not grainfree my fault I shouldn’t have bought.
customer_reviews.text: I guess I should have paid closer attention I guess I assumed less ingredients would mean healthy but my poor dog itches so badly from this dog food it didn’t say grain free anywhere it was my mistake. We had to give away to a less itchy dog.
customer_reviews.author: LaForge

customer_reviews.title: Happy Greyhounds!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a long time Iams customer, but awhile back either they changed formulas or I got a bad bag. Neither dog ate much and when they did they got really gassy. I read the reviews for this Just 6 and decided it was time for a change. They love it!! Both gobble it up immediately, neither dog has room clearing farts any more and their poops are more like poops, not squirts. Hooraaaayyyy!
customer_reviews.author: richieoTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great food for my two pups!
customer_reviews.text: Been giving this to my pups for years now and have never had a problem. My one dog has had cancer for 4 years and still going. Not really sure if it’s the food but he still wants to eat it. I’ve tried other brands here and there but always come back to this one.
customer_reviews.author: Bart

customer_reviews.title: I blame my dog's tummy, not this food!
customer_reviews.text: I tried this with my beagle mix who has a sensitive stomach, as I wanted to get away from the prescription food (and expense) of Royal Canin. We mixed this in with her gastro food eventually replacing it and she was very gassy and eventually had runny and smelly poo. I've returned her to the gastro food and will be sticking with that and carrots, apple, and bananas for treats. She will sometimes get a bloody poo when her stomach gets upset, so its just not worth trying to switch her when the other food keeps her stable. Lesson learned. I gave it a 3 because she seemed to like it, but it just didn't work for us.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Jobe

customer_reviews.title: Animals LOVE This Food!!!
customer_reviews.text: My black lab/bulldog mix LOVES this food! He and the cat are very picky. My 13 year old cat will only eat THIS food (hope it won't cause damage to the feline, but at this age, he gets what he wants..lol) They devour this food! Thanks!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Gaudin

customer_reviews.title: Akita seems to really like
customer_reviews.text: My Akita seems to like it. He’s 8 and has had a lot of skin problems in last two years. Hoping this will help that out. It’s winter though so I’ll report back in the summer to see if skin problem comes back with the heat.
customer_reviews.author: JS

product_meta.title: Rachael Ray Nutrish Just 6 Limited Ingredient Diet Dry Dog Food
product_meta.description: Flavor Name:Lamb Meal & Brown Rice| Size:28 Lb. BagRachael Ray Nutrish Just 6 Lamb Meal & Brown Rice Recipe is made with just six simple, natural ingredients with added vitamins & minerals. Lamb meal is the 1 ingredient, followed by five other wholesome ingredients. Of course, Just 6 doesn’t contain any corn, wheat, soy or gluten ingredients. And there’s never any poultry by-product meal, artificial flavors, colors or artificial preservatives. Nothing but good, wholesome food here.
feature_bullets: Contains (1) 28 Pound Bag of Dry Dog Food
Limited ingredient diet which may help dogs avoid food sensitivities
No poultry by-product meal, artificial flavors or artificial preservatives
Just 6 easily-digestible, natural ingredients with added vitamins & minerals

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
